net.xuset.objectIO.connections

Class ConnectionHub<T extends ConnectionI>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.ConnectionHub<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of ConnectionI that will be stored
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    HubI<T>

    public class ConnectionHub<T extends ConnectionI>
extends java.lang.Object
implements HubI<T>
    A basic implementation of HubI.
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    ConnectionI

    • Method Detail

      • addConnection

        public boolean addConnection(T connection)
        Description copied from interface: HubI
        Stores a connection. Once added, the connection can be retrieved using getConnectionById(long) and getConnectionByIndex(int)
        Specified by:
        addConnection in interface HubI<T extends ConnectionI>
        Parameters:
        connection - the connection to store
        Returns:
        true if the method was successful in adding the connection
        See Also:
        ConnectionI

      • removeConnection

        public boolean removeConnection(T connection)
        Description copied from interface: HubI
        Removes a previously stored connection.
        Specified by:
        removeConnection in interface HubI<T extends ConnectionI>
        Parameters:
        connection - the connection to remove
        Returns:
        true if the connection was found and removed successfully
        See Also:
        ConnectionI

      • getConnectionById

        public T getConnectionById(long id)
        Description copied from interface: HubI
        Searches stored connections for an id matching the supplied argument id. The id of stored connections is determined by ConnectionI.getId().

        It is good practice when adding connections to the hub to not add multiple connections with same id. This can cause unexpected results.

        Specified by:
        getConnectionById in interface HubI<T extends ConnectionI>
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the connection to return
        Returns:
        returns a connection with an id equal to connectionId. If no connection is found, null is returned.
        See Also:
        ConnectionI

      • sendMsg

        public boolean sendMsg(MarkupMsg message,
              long connectionId)
        Sends a message to a stored connection whose id equals connectionId If there are multiple connections with the same id, only the connection that was added first gets sent the message. If the connectionId equals Connection.BROADCAST_CONNECTION then broadcastMsg(MarkupMsg) is called and returned.
        Specified by:
        sendMsg in interface HubI<T extends ConnectionI>
        Parameters:
        message - the message to send
        connectionId - the id of the connection to use
        Returns:
        returns true if the message sent successfully or false if no connection was found or the sending the message failed
        See Also:
        ConnectionI

      • broadcastMsg

        public boolean broadcastMsg(MarkupMsg message)
        Sends a message to every stored connection.
        Specified by:
        broadcastMsg in interface HubI<T extends ConnectionI>
        Parameters:
        message - the message sent to all stored connections
        Returns:
        true only if each message was sent successfully, false otherwise

      • getConnectionByIndex

        public T getConnectionByIndex(int index)
        Description copied from interface: HubI
        Returns a stored connection. This can be used to traverse all the stored connections. Connections are not Guaranteed to be in specific order. If index is less than zero or greater than HubI.getConnectionCount() then a IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        getConnectionByIndex in interface HubI<T extends ConnectionI>
        Parameters:
        index - index of the element to return.
        Returns:
        the connection at the specified index
        See Also:
        ConnectionI

      • getConnectionCount

        public int getConnectionCount()
        Description copied from interface: HubI
        Returns the number of connections that are stored. This can be used along with getConnectionByIndex to access all the stored connections.
        Specified by:
        getConnectionCount in interface HubI<T extends ConnectionI>
        Returns:
        the amount of connections stored.
